intro: Tetrameris trivalvis, commonly known as the three-valved tetrameris, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Tetrameris trivalvis is primarily found in high-altitude regions and is adapted to the cool, moist climate of its native habitat.
